d: Before getting started, take some time to check-in.
At the end of the last session, everyone in your group was challenged in two ways:
You were asked to pray for five people from your List of 100 that you marked as an "Unbeliever" or "Unknown."
You were encouraged to share how to make a List of 100 with someone.
Take a few moments to see how your group did this week.

parts.d: Pray and thank God for the results and invite His Holy Spirit to lead your time together.

d: In this session, you’ll learn how God’s Spiritual Economy works and how God invests more in those who are faithful with what they've already been given. You'll also learn two more tools for making disciples – sharing God’s Story from Creation to Judgement and Baptism.
Then, when you're ready, get started!

sections.d: Learn how God's economy is different from the world's. God invests more in those who are faithful with what they've already been given.

parts.d: In this broken world, people feel rewarded when they take, when they receive and when they gain more than those around them. But God's Spiritual Economy is different – God invests more in those who are faithful with what they've already been given.

questions: What are some differences you see between God's Spiritual Economy and our earthly way of getting things done?

d: Jesus said, “You will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes upon you. And you will be my witnesses, telling people about me everywhere – in Jerusalem, throughout Judea, in Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
Jesus believed in His followers so much, He trusted them to tell His story. Then He sent them around the world to do it. Now, He’s sending us.

There’s no one “best way” to tell God’s story (also called The Gospel), because the best way will depend on who you’re sharing with. Every disciple should learn to tell God’s Story in a way that’s true to scripture and connects with the audience they’re sharing with.

questions: What comes to mind when you hear God's command to be His "witness" and to tell His story?
Why do you think Jesus chose ordinary people instead of some other way to share His Good News?
What would it take for you to feel more comfortable sharing God's Story?

sections.t: The Gospel and How to Share It
sections.d: Learn a way to share God’s Good News from the beginning of humanity all the way to the end of this age.

d.d: One way to share God’s Good News is by telling God’s Story from Creation to Judgement – from the beginning of humankind all the way to the end of this age.

questions: What do you learn about mankind from this story?
What do you learn about God?
Do you think it would be easier or harder to share God's Story by telling a story like this?

sections.info: Break into groups of two or three people and spend the next 45 minutes practicing telling God's Story. You can use the using the Activity instructions for "God's Story" found in your Zúme Guidebook.

sections.t: Baptism and How To Do It
sections.d: Jesus said, “Go and make disciples of all nations, BAPTIZING them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit…” Learn how to put this into practice.

d.d: Jesus said, “Go and make disciples of all nations, BAPTIZING them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit…”

questions: If the Great Commission is for every follower of Jesus, does that mean every follower is allowed to baptize others? Why or why not?
info: IMPORTANT REMINDER – Have you been baptized?
If not, then we encourage you to plan this before even one more session of this training. Invite your group to be a part of this important day when you celebrate saying "yes" to Jesus.

sections.info: Below are next steps to take in preparation for the next session.

parts.d: Spend time this week practicing God's Story, and then share it with at least one person from your List of 100 that you marked as "Unbeliever" or "Unknown."
Ask God who He wants you to train to use the Creation to Judgment story (or some other way to share God's Story). Share this person's name with the group before you go.
Pray that God helps you be obedient to Him and invite Him to work in you and those around you!
What’s been your Zúme highlight? Tell others about it on social media.

parts.info: IMPORTANT REMINDER – Your group will be celebrating the Lord's Supper next session. Be sure to remember the supplies (bread and wine / juice).
